issue.title: issue with calling best_callable when best returns a constant function.
issue.body:
When calling best_callable on a function pysr returns as a constant, I get the following error.

TypeError: _lambdifygenerated() missing 1 required positional argument: 'x1'

Could best_callable be adapted for constant functions as well?

nodes.body: What version of PySR are you running? This looks like the old API.
I have this version pysr-0.5.16.post2 and even uninstalling and reinstalling gives me this version using pip. Is there a julia/python version requirement?

Ah, that is why. You need 0.6 and up. Upgrade with:
```
pip install --upgrade pysr
```

By the way - sorry I didn't mention it, but to use `best_callable`, pass the same `X` as you passed to the PySR call. The same is true even for constant solutions (though in that case, I suppose any array would work...).
